trans-unit.source: Retrieves the information about the raw input devices for the current application

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the information about the raw input devices for the current application

target.mrk: Retrieves the information about the raw input devices for the current application

trans-unit.source: A pointer to the buffer to receive an array of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures for the application.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to the buffer to receive an array of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures for the application.

target.mrk: A pointer to the buffer to receive an array of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures for the application.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required buffer size, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required buffer size, in bytes.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function returns the required buffer size, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

target.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: the number of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures written to the buffer.

seg-source.mrk: the number of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures written to the buffer.

target.mrk: the number of $tagRAWINPUTDEVICE structures written to the buffer.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag contains the last error code.
